document_data.name: ''Bowl of Watery Death''
document_data.mainbody: A '''''bowl of watery death''''' was a cursed [[magical item]] that drowned [[wizard]]s who used it.
document_data.Description: Indistinguishable from a ''[[bowl of commanding water elementals]]'', the ''bowl of watery death'' was a bowl {{SI|1|foot|c|long=yes}} across, half that much deep, made of semi-precious stones such as [[malachite]], [[lapis lazuli]], or sometimes [[jade]].
document_data.History:
One such bowl was the only enchanted item among the wares in an abandoned shop selling grotesque-looking bowls in the [[Imaskari]] ruins underneath [[Solon]] in the {{yearlinkName|1367}}.{{cite book/Blood Charge|62}} Similar magic was used in one of the trials of [[Red Mountain Monastery]].{{cite book/Blood Charge|36}}

These devices were known in [[Zakhara]].
